H0.text: Porous is the characteristic of spongy bone, which is found inside bones and is lighter and less dense than compact bone.

H1.text: Amorphous is the reason spongy bone, found inside bones and lighter and less dense than compact bone, has its structure.

H2.text: Pliable is the characteristic of spongy bone that is found inside bones and is lighter and less dense than compact bone.

H3.text: Fibrous is what spongy bone is because it is found inside bones and is lighter and less dense than compact bone.

A4.text: Cancellous bone or spongy bone, also known as trabecular bone, is the internal tissue of the skeletal bone and is an open cell porous network that follows the material properties of biofoams.

A5.text: Cancellous bone has a higher surface-area-to-volume ratio than cortical bone and it is less dense.
